variant.question: A pilot is preparing for a flight and manually extracts the relevant data from the aircraft performance charts. He then goes to cross check this data with his EFB and notices a difference in the values. What may be the cause for this variance?

options.text: The EFB is more accurate as it does not interpolate the parametres
The tables are no longer adequate for airplanes with such height levels of automation
The EFB is more accurate and the values are more conservative
The tables have an added safety factor of 1.5 included

variant.question: Assuming the same runway and associated conditions, which statement below best describes the reason for the differences between the performance figures produced by the modern performance software in an Electronic Flight Bag (EFB), when compared to those derived from the Regulated Take-Off Weight (RTOW) tables?

options.text: The EFB figures are more accurate because a computer is able to consider more accurate parameters and apply these without interpolation.
EFB calculations are more accurate and will therefore produce more conservative performance figures than retrieved from RTOW tables.
The RTOW tables are typically older and therefore NOT suitable for use in a modern aeroplane where a lot of processes are automated.
Performance figures from the RTOW tables are more conservative as they include a safety factor of 1.15 that is NOT applied in the EFB calculations.

variant.question:
Refer to figure. 
 The annex shows an example of an RTOM chart for a medium jet aeroplane at a particular runway. In each chart box, the following information is provided for a given wind component, and a given outside air temperature: MTOM / limitation code / V~1~-V~R~-V~2~. What are the limitations for a departure with MTOM of 67 500 kg and 10 kt tailwind?

Refer to figure. 
 The annex shows an example of an RTOM chart for a medium jet aeroplane at a particular runway. In each chart box, the following information is provided for a given wind component, and a given outside air temperature: MTOM / limitation code / V~1~-V~R~-V~2~. What is the meaning of the code 4/4?
